conversation.message:
Hi Company_C—thank you. Sharing 2 concise work-sample style summaries that best reflect program ownership + process/tooling improvement:

1) Intake workflow redesign (end-to-end ownership)
- Situation: Requests were coming in across multiple channels with unclear SLAs, leading to ~5-day average turnaround and heavy status-chasing.
- What I did: Mapped the current flow, defined a single intake form with required fields, introduced lightweight triage rules + ownership, and set up a simple dashboard (volume, aging, SLA) with weekly stakeholder updates.
- Outcome: Reduced avg turnaround from ~5 days to ~2 days, cut ad-hoc pings via standardized comms, and improved predictability/throughput.

2) Cross-functional launch coordination (execution + stakeholder mgmt)
- Situation: A time-sensitive rollout had unclear dependencies across Ops/Eng/Support.
- What I did: Built a milestone plan with owners/risks, ran a tight weekly cadence, maintained a single source of truth for decisions, and unblocked teams by clarifying requirements and sequencing.
- Outcome: Shipped on schedule with fewer late-stage surprises; improved handoffs and reduced rework through clearer requirements and decision logging.

If helpful, I can also turn either into a 1-page write-up (problem → approach → artifacts → results). If your current priority conversations don’t convert, I’m ready to move immediately to next steps.

conversation.message:
Hi Company_C—thank you. As requested, here’s a 1-page style write-up for the intake workflow redesign (problem → approach → artifacts → results), including the concrete artifacts + tools.

Title: Intake Workflow Redesign (single-channel intake + triage + SLA visibility)

Problem
- Requests arrived via multiple channels (email/DMs/docs) with inconsistent information and unclear ownership.
- No shared SLA or visibility, leading to heavy status-chasing and ~5-day average turnaround.

Approach
1) Diagnose current state
- Mapped the end-to-end flow (request → triage → assignment → execution → close-out) and identified the top delay points: missing info, unclear priority, and handoff gaps.

2) Standardize intake + required info
- Implemented a single intake form with required fields so requests were actionable on arrival.

3) Lightweight triage rules + clear ownership
- Set simple priority tiers and routing rules; established a single DRI for triage and explicit owners for each request.

4) Visibility + cadence
- Built a small dashboard and ran a weekly stakeholder update to review volume, aging, SLA performance, and blockers.

Artifacts (what I created)
- Intake form (examples of key fields): requester/team, problem statement, desired outcome, due date, impact (users/$/risk), dependencies, required approvers, links to context, priority tier (guided).
- Triage rules (examples):
  • P0: compliance/revenue-risk or exec-committed → same-day triage + immediate assignment
  • P1: time-sensitive with defined deadline/impact → triage within 1 business day
  • P2: standard requests → triage within 2 business days
  • “Missing required fields” → returned to requester with a checklist
- Workflow states: New → Triage → Assigned → In Progress → Blocked → Ready for Review → Done (with definitions for each)
- Dashboard metrics: incoming volume/week, backlog size, aging by priority, SLA attainment %, cycle time, top blockers categories
- Weekly update template: SLA summary, wins shipped, risks/blockers, asks/decisions needed

Tools used
- Intake form + tracker: Google Forms + Google Sheets (later mirrored into a simple ticketing board)
- Dashboard: Google Sheets pivot + charts (and a lightweight Looker Studio view for stakeholders)
- Comms/cadence: Slack channel + weekly email/notes; shared doc as single source of truth

Results
- Reduced average turnaround time from ~5 days to ~2 days.
- Cut ad-hoc status pings by standardizing updates and making the dashboard the default reference.
- Increased predictability: clearer prioritization, fewer mid-stream rework loops due to missing intake info.

If you’d like, I can also share the exact triage rubric and the dashboard layout (columns + formulas/definitions) in a short follow-up. I remain ready to move quickly if you decide to pivot from the current priority conversations.
conversation.thought: Only Company_C remains unmatched and it is my #1 true preference.
